full_summary:
## Automated Chemistry Analyzer Solicitation Notice

### Solicitation Number: 5A044-225062B
### Procurement Category: Goods and Services

#### Tender Details

* **Solicitation Title:** Automated Chemistry Analyzer
* **Closing Date and Time:** September 19, 2023, 14:00 HAE
* **Publication Date:** September 1, 2023
* **Description:** The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites bidders to participate in a Request for Proposal to supply one new automated chemistry analyzer, including onsite installation and user training, to Indigenous Services Canada.

#### Notice Requirements

* The solicitation cancels and supersedes previous solicitation number Doc3994674035, dated August 4, 2023, with a closing date of August 29, 2023.
* A debriefing or feedback session will be provided upon request to bidders who submitted offers on the previous solicitation.
* All bids must be submitted electronically through the Ariba Discovery platform by the closing date and time.

#### Selection Criteria

* Offers will be evaluated based on the lowest price.

#### Trade Agreements

* This solicitation is open to bidders who can supply goods manufactured in any of the following countries:
	+ Canada
	+ Panama (under the Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement)
	+ Chile (under the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA))
	+ Korea (under the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA))
	+ Honduras (under the Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement)
	+ Colombia (under the Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement)
	+ Peru (under the Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA))
	+ Panama (under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA))

#### Contact Information

* Matthew Havrilenko: [matthew.havrilenko@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:matthew.havrilenko@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca) (SPAC/PSPC)
* Phone: (None provided)
* Fax: (None provided)
* Address: (None provided)

#### Notice URL

* https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17336427

Note that I removed some redundant or irrelevant information to adhere to the word limit while maintaining the core intent of the original text. I also made some minor styling changes to improve readability. Let me know if you'd like me to revise anything further.
